job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Coos Bay, OR
cons: Frequent calls to request to come in on days off

job_title: PSA/Patient Safety Assistant in Coos Bay, OR
pros: The benefits are great and affordable. You will learn a lot and meet some good people. Security is great and keeps you safe. As an employee you get a discount at the cafeteria.
cons: You are given the bare minimum training in Crisis prevention and you have to learn from your peers. The patient safety assistants do not get paid good for the work they do. You are mostly sitting with a patient your whole shift and caring for them. There are a lot of mental health patients you sit with and no training on active listening, motivational interviewing, trauma informed care and mental health first aid. If you speak up to the manager she will shut you down and be dismissive. The manager is always busy and rude to those that don't agree with her and aren't a yes man or woman. If you want to advance in your career the only route seems to be a Certified nursing assistant or registered nurse, which I am not interested in either. The house supervisor acts more like your manager then your supervisor does. The union dues are too expensive. You are going to get burnt out easily if you don't have a good support system and don't take care of yourself.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Coos Bay, OR
pros: The community at the hospital and within the town itself is very nice. Most people are kind and friendly to you. Overall, the workplace environment is very collaborative and people want to see you succeed.
cons: Unfortunately there are some management issues I ran into. The higher ups don’t seem to know or understand the needs of some of their employees. Communication within that hierarchy can be painful sometimes.
